title: By Brakhage: an anthology [DVD]
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Death

abstract: Disc 1: Desistfilm (1954, 7 min.)--Wedlock house: an intercourse (1959, 10 min.)--Dog star man (1961-1964): Prelude (25 min.), Part 1 (30 min.), Part 2 (5 min), Part 3 (7 min.), Part 4 (6 min.)--The Act of seeing with one's own eyes (1971, 31 min.) Disc 2: Cat's cradle (1959, 6 min.)--Window water baby moving (1959, 12 min.)--Mothlight (1963, 3 min.)--Eye myth (1972, 9 sec.)--The Wold shadow (1972, 2 min.)--The Garden of earthly delights (1981, 1.5 min.)--The Stars are beautiful (1974, 18 min.)--Kindering (1987, 3 min.)--I...dreaming (1988, 7 min)--The Dante quartet (1987, 6 min.)--Nightmusic (1986, 32 sec.)--Rage net (1988, 1 min.)--Glaze of cathexis (1990, 3 min.)--Delicacies of molten horror synapse (1991, 8 min.)--Untitled (For Marilyn) (1992, 10 min.)--Black ice (1994, 2 min.)--Study in color and black and white (1993, 1.5 min.)--Stellar (1993, 2 min.)--Crack glass eulogy (1996, 6 min.)--The Dark tower (1999, 2 min.)--Commingled containers (1997, 3 min.)--Love song (2001, 11 min.)
description: Influential American avant-garde artist Stan Brakhage (1933-2003) made nearly four hundred films over fifty years. Addressing grand themes of birth, sex and death, Brakhage pioneered the art of handmade films - scratching, drawing and painting directly on to the film itself. This compilation contains twenty-six works by Brakhage including some of his most famous titles. Interviews and audio commentary by Brakhage, as well as an accompanying booklet, provide a fascinating insight into his philosophical and technical processes.
